greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of circumradius of a regular dodecahedron with edge length 1.
comment: Dodecahedron: A three dimensional figure with 12 faces, 20 vertices, and 30 edges.
Appears as a coordinate in a degree-7 quadrature formula on 12 points over the unit circle [Stroud & Secrest]. - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 12 2011
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10001
A. H. Stroud, D. Secrest, Approximate integration formulas for certain spherically symmetric regions, Math. Comp. 17 (82) (1963) 105
formula: The minimal polynomial is 16*x^4 - 36*x^2 + 9. [_Joerg Arndt_, Feb 05 2014]
xref: Cf. Platonic solids circumradii: A010503 (octahedron), A010527 (cube), A019881 (icosahedron), A187110 (tetrahedron). - _Stanislav Sykora_, Feb 10 2014
results.author: _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jul 09 2010
